content:
But wrap-span">enthusiasm for their new work has gradually wrap-span">dwindled

THE 1960s were blessed with a wrap-span">batch of wrap-span">extraordinary wrap-span">songwriters. Half a century on, few are still producing any original material of note. Chief among them are the two 76-year-old Pauls: wrap-span">McCartney and Simon, both of whom released new albums on September 7th.

Most of their recent output has been critically wrap-span">acclaimed. In its review of “Egypt Station”, Mr wrap-span">McCartney’s latest record, Rolling Stone marvelled at his capacity to keep “adding new wrap-span">gems to his wrap-span">songbook”. Praise for “In the Blue Light”, Mr Simon’s album, has been more wrap-span">muted—largely because it consists of rearranwrap-span">gements of wrap-span">lesser-known old songs. But “Stranger to Stranger”, an original album he produced in 2016, was a hit. The wrap-span">Guardian , in a five-star review, claimed it was “as rewarding as anything he’s done”.

Review data for the two wrap-span">septuagenarians prove that great wrap-span">songwriters do not suddenly lose their ability to craft wrap-span">memorable wrap-span">tunes and lyrics. Since 2000 Mr Simon’s albums have had an average rating of 3.9 stars out of 5, just a hair lower than the score for his previous solo records. Mr wrap-span">McCartney’s average in the 21st century has been 3.5—not as wrap-span">stellar, but wrap-span">considerably better than the 2.9 stars he managed wrap-span">beforehand.

Critics generally panned albums by Wings, Mr wrap-span">McCartney’s post-wrap-span">Beatles band, many of which were wrap-span">dominated by wrap-span">whimsical soft-rock wrap-span">fluff. But if his early solo output seemed like an unsatisfying change in direction from the wrap-span">Fab Four, “Egypt Station” feels less so, thanks to its wrap-span">deliberately wrap-span">Beatles-esque feel. Mr wrap-span">McCartney says that the wrap-span">loose concept, of a train passing from place to place, “reminded me of the ‘album’ albums we used to make”.

Fans of his wrap-span">mellow, wrap-span">introspective wrap-span">compositions from the late 1960s will be pleased. At least five of the new songs could have been wrap-span">pinched from wrap-span">bootlegged sessions for “The White Album” or “Abbey Road”, with the author musing on an wrap-span">acoustic wrap-span">guitar or piano. The best is “I Don’t Know”, which sounds like a wrap-span">companion to “Let It Be”, wrap-span">albeit no longer with mother Mary’s wrap-span">solace: “Well, I see trouble at every turn / I’ve got so many lessons to learn / What am I doing wrong, I don’t know.”

wrap-span">Where Mr wrap-span">McCartney has wrap-span">embellished these songs, it is usually by overdubbing his voice and adding a wrap-span">harpsichord or strings, to wrap-span">accentuate the wrap-span">Beatles flavour. Two closing tracks are meant to be Wings-era wrap-span">episodic numbers, echoing “Band on the Run” and “Live and Let Die”. The low point is the dance-themed “Fuh You”, which feels like seeing your grandpa in a wrap-span">nightclub, yelling: “I just wrap-span">wanna fuh you, I just wrap-span">wanna fuh you”. But those wrap-span">excesses are worth tolerating for wrap-span">tender songs like “Do It Now”, a favourite wrap-span">phrase of Mr wrap-span">McCartney’s long-dead father, who encourages him to wrap-span">seize the day: “Do it now / While the feeling is here / If you leave it too late / It could all disappear.”

Mr Simon is a completely different type of wrap-span">songwriter. wrap-span">Whereas Mr wrap-span">McCartney’s lyrics can sound like wrap-span">childlike ditties, Mr Simon’s often wrap-span">resemble free-form poems set to music. “America”, the best that he penned while working with Art wrap-span">Garfunkel, wrap-span">narrates a couple’s road-trip without a single wrap-span">rhyme. The song’s wrap-span">desperate night-time wrap-span">loneliness—“wrap-span">Cathy, I'm lost, I said though I knew she was sleeping / I’m empty and aching and I don’t know why”—is Mr Simon’s default setting. Even his most wrap-span">upbeat solo hits, like “You Can Call Me Al”, are really songs of abandonment. “My nights are so long,” he wrap-span">laments, recalling days on the road. “wrap-span">Where’s my wife and family? What if I die here?”

His new album is firmly in that tradition. Its title comes from the opening of “How the Heart Approwrap-span">aches What It wrap-span">Yearns”, in which a man sits “in the blue light of the Belvedere wrap-span">Motel / Wondering as the television burns”. The most wrap-span">fleshed-out of the album’s sombre subjects is the wrap-span">weary husband in “Darling wrap-span">Lorraine”, whose wrap-span">resentment disappears when his wife becomes ill. He too ends up wrap-span">heartbroken in the dark: “Here’s an extra blanket honey, to wrap around your feet / All the trees were washed with April rain / And the moon in the wrap-span">meadow took darling wrap-span">Lorraine.”

The wrap-span">novelty that Mr Simon adds to these songs, most of which have been wrap-span">rehashed from his later albums, is the wrap-span">instrumental backing of yMusic, a classical wrap-span">sextet. Unfortunately the best of these arranwrap-span">gements, an wrap-span">orchestral treatment of “The Sound of Silence” (yet another lyric about wrap-span">nocturnal wrap-span">solitude) has only appeared at concerts. When listening to Mr Simon’s entire catalogue, it seems his best songs are backed by other singers: either the South African artists on “wrap-span">Graceland” or Mr wrap-span">Garfunkel’s wrap-span">angelic voice. Mr Simon’s later output has been interesting, but rarely as wrap-span">melodic as his work with Mr wrap-span">Garfunkel.

The same is true for Mr wrap-span">McCartney, whose wrap-span">catchy wrap-span">tunes benefited from John wrap-span">Lennon’s wrap-span">acerbic contributions. Unfortunately, the squabbling between both of these 1960s wrap-span">duos ended any chance of later wrap-span">collaborations. Critics might still rate the solo albums highly, but for ordinary fans the appeal has wrap-span">dwindled. Few wrap-span">casual listeners on Spotify have paid much attention to recent records. Only the die-hards are left.

wp.yearn for: 渴望;向往;非常想念;渴思

eg2: The man who has everything is in some way is a poor man. He will never know what it feels like to , to hope, to nourish his soul with the dream of something better.
一个拥有一切的人在某些方面也是个穷人，他永远不会知道什么是渴望、什么是期待；永远不知道用渴求更美好的东西来充实他的灵魂。
Yet we all  for that deep connection with others, those moments of bliss, joy, completeness.
然而，我们都渴望与别人深入的交往, 渴望那些幸福、快乐、圆满的时刻。
There is nothing mysterious about this; in every aspect of life, we  for things to be regular and parallel.
这点没有任何神秘的；生活中的每一方面，我们都渴望事物是有规律和对等的。

ex: vt. 强调；重读

wp.accentuate asymmetries: 突出不对称;强调不对称

eg2: Then  them as you dress to go out.
你打扮出门时强调一下这些特点。
The lighting wall serves to accentuate the nature of the material and interfuses modern technology and light.
照明墙是用来强调材料的自然性，它也融合了现代技术与灯光。
Strauss-Kahn knows all this, of course. But the Daejon meeting was an opportunity to  the positive and not to dwell -- too much at least -- on the past.
施特劳斯-卡恩当然明了所有这些问题.但大田会议毕竟是一个强调积极面,而不必太纠结于历史的机会.

eg2: My Criminal Law professor, Steve Duke, was a witty,  man and a fine teacher with whom I later did a seminar on white-collar crime.
我的“刑法”教授是史蒂夫·杜克，他是一个风趣、尖刻的人，是个好老师，我后来与他一起摘了一个关于白领犯罪的讨论会。
They were both heavyset and inclined toward a projection of light amusement, although hers seemed more .
他们都很粗壮，并且心理投影都倾向轻娱乐，尽管她的看起来更尖刻。
Written after a short visit to the UK (his first), his essay is not just witty and , it is humblingly observant.
此文写于他（首次）短暂访问英国之后。 他的散文不仅诙谐尖刻，其观察之细致入微也足以令人汗颜。

eg2: Every bone in my body seems to .

The excruciating pain of the first blast is gone, and now there is the throb and  of an amputated soul.
第一次爆发的极度痛苦已经消失，现在有的是一个被截去一部分的灵魂的悸动和疼痛。
Established truths are comforting, but it is the mysteries that make the soul  and render a life of exploration worth living.
已经确定的真理让人鼓舞，但是却是那些谜团让灵魂渴望，让我们为值得探索的事物而活。

ex: adj. 天使的；似天使的；天国的

wp.Angelic Alliance: 天使联盟;安琪儿联盟;天使同盟

eg2: Every nation has these angelic powers or satanic powers, because of course Satan is himself depicted as an angel in the Jewish Bible.
每个国家都有这些天使力量或者撒旦力量，因为当然撒旦本身,在犹太圣经中就被描述为一个天使。
That higher self wants you to know, as do we of the angelic Realm, how much you are loved, how important and magnificent you truly are.
这高我想让你们知道，也是我们天使领域存有所想的，你们是多么深地被爱着，确实地你们有多重要和伟大。
The collective energy of light I am speaking of is an angelic realm that is deeply connected to humanity and earth because it helped to create man and earth.
我所谈到的集体光能是一个天使王国，它与人类和地球的关系很密切，因为是它帮助创造了人类和地球。

但是，在真正的科学精神中，我们欣赏这种竞争，因为我们知道如果我们不努力，在下一批令人兴奋的发现中，我们就会错过下一颗宝贵的行星。
A message arriving on the queue may find itself toward the end of a , in which case its processing will be delayed.
到达队列的消息可能会发现自己排在一批消息的末尾，在这种情况下，对它的处理将延迟。

eg2: a casual manner
漫不经心的样子
It was just a casual remark─I wasn't really serious.
我只是随便说说，并不当真。
He tried to sound casual, but I knew he was worried.
他讲话时试图显得不在乎，但我知道他心里着急。

他们对安全问题采取无所谓的态度。
a casual glance

It's obvious even to the casual observer.

casual clothes(= comfortable clothes that you choose to wear in your free time)
便装
family parties and other casual occasions
家庭聚会和其他非正式场合
casual workers/labour
临时工
Students sometimes do casual work in the tourist trade.
学生有时做些旅游方面的零工。
They are employed on a casual basis(= they do not have a permanent job with the company) .
他们被雇为临时工。
a casual acquaintance
泛泛之交
a casual friendship
一般的友谊
to have casual sex(= to have sex without having a steady relationship with that partner)
做露水鸳鸯
a casual encounter/meeting
不期而遇；邂逅
a casual passer-by
碰巧过路的人
The exhibition is interesting to both the enthusiast and the casual visitor.
热心的爱好者和碰巧来参观的人都认为这个展览有意思。
The disease is not spread by casual contact.
此病不会通过偶然接触传染。
dressed in casuals
穿着便装

ex: adj. 引人注意的；容易记住的；易使人上当的
eg2: It’s , and it can produce flashes of humor and even poetry.
俚语不仅诱人，而且能够产生幽默和甚至富有诗意的闪光。
If you can think of a catchy domain name, get it registered for less than $10.
如果你能想到的一个引人注目的域名，注册用不了10美元。
That’s not as  as setting up emergency feeding clinics in a famine-devastated land, but it’s far cheaper to avert the crisis than to wait for it.
相对于在一贫如洗的土地上设立紧急喂养诊所，那些计划并不太讨巧，不过袖手旁观比应对粮食危机要付出更大的代价。

ex: adj. 天真烂漫的；孩子似的
eg2: And last, if you have children, let them be .
最后，如果你有孩子，那就让他们有个孩子样儿吧！
Our goal as adults should be to become more .
作为成年人，我们应该更加天真烂漫。
Most of your childlike drawings will be tossed in the trash, but some might be put up on the fridge.
你的大多数如孩子般的绘画作品会被扔进垃圾桶，但总会有几幅是可以贴在冰箱上值得你炫耀的。

ex: adv. 相当地；非常地
eg2: This religious group has considerably more vegetarians than the general population.
这个宗教集团比普通群体有相当更多的素食者。
Because each task can have its own logical processor, it receives considerably more processor time for the same given duration of the test.
因为每一个任务都有其自己的逻辑处理器，所以在同一给定的测试期间它会收到相当多的处理器时间。
It will be necessary to pare this budget down .
有必要大大地削减这笔预算。

ex: adv. 故意地；谨慎地；慎重地
eg2: He deliberately roughed the goal-keeper.
他故意冲撞守门员。
She deliberately stayed behind after work to go with me.
下班后她故意留下来等我一起走。
The acrobat deliberately faulted the performance once to make it look difficult.
表演者故意把表演做错一次，以显得表演很难。

ex: adj. 不顾一切的；令人绝望的；极度渴望的
eg2: I was  to hear someone call my name or the digging machine start up, but there was only silence.
我极度渴望听见有人呼喊我的名字,或是听见挖土机起动的声音,但周围一片寂静。
Your description , but only to analysis the statement of the word, you let us see the fundamental mistake.
你的描述令人绝望，不过只是对分析而言，你的陈述让人看到了它的根本错误。
Sober nations have all at once become desperate gamblers, and risked almost their existence upon the turn of a piece of paper.
原本头脑清醒的国民突然马上变成了不顾一切的赌徒，将他们的生活建立在一张纸上。

ex: n. 小曲；小调
n. (Ditty)人名；(英)迪蒂

wp.ditty bag: 杂物袋;装零星杂物的袋子;水手手提袋

eg2: Regardless, the little  conveyed foundational information in a happy little package.
不管怎样，这首小调在欢快的节奏下传递了基本的信息。

Title: For Paul McCartney and Paul Simon, age is no hindrance to song-writing

paperStatistics.title: For Paul McCartney and Paul Simon, age is no hindrance to song-writing
paperStatistics.desc: But enthusiasm for their new work has gradually dwindled
